Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of rosette in added white outline with added red centre; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Cook and Woodhead identify the sherd as coming from a phiale. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169). rosettes are not frequently found on Type B1 kantharoi. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. The number 34 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 168, no. 108)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 724, no. 833)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1778) (phase 2)
